member_organisations: The diocese comprises 300 member congregations spread over 42 countries. The worldwide Anglican Communion of which the Archbishop of Canterbury is the titular head has 95 million members spread over 142 countries.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, External Relations, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Migration, Trafficking, financial ethics and regulation, reconciliation in community conflict situations, climate change, human rights and anti-discrimination, work-life balance, education, child protection, bioethics, family and social concerns, religious liberty
organisation_name: Office of the Anglican Bishop in Europe
section: V - Organisations representing churches and religious communities
subsection: Organisations representing churches and religious communities
membership:
Church of England  
www.churchofengland.org 
Anglican Communion

relevant_communication: written and oral submissions to Article 17 dialogue sessions, annual colloquium on fundamental rights, and Commission consultations on relevant legislation
goals__remit: Oversight of Anglican Churches in Europe and Representation of the Archbishop of Canterbury to the EU
